questions.question: How does someone become a member of the Senate?

choices.answer: They are appointed by the Prime Minister.
They are elected by Canadians.
They are hired by the House of Commons.

questions.question: The head of state in Canada who doesn't play an active role in its government is:

choices.answer: The Prime Minister.
The Governor General.
The King or Queen of England.
One party has more than 50% of the votes.
One party has more than 50% of the seats.
One party has less than 50% of the seats.

questions.question: What is the second step in the process of a bill becoming a law?

choices.answer: Royal Assent by the Governor General
Judicial Review by the Supreme Court
House of Commons (MPs) accept bill

questions.question: What is the final step in the process of a bill becoming a law?

choices.answer: Royal Assent by the Governor General
Judicial Review by the Supreme Court
House of Commons (MPs) accepts bill

questions.question: Which of the following is something a lobbyist does not do?

choices.answer: Provide technical expertise to government
Propose alternative courses of action to political leaders
Voice the views & perspectives of different groups of people
Ensure the ruling political party stays in power

questions.question: How do MPs get voted into the House of Commons?

choices.answer: Representation by population
Receiving half the votes
Coming in second place

questions.question: The main roles of the Members of Parliament are:

choices.answer: Run the daily business of government and apply laws
Represent minority groups and support their political party
Support the party to which they belong and vote on bills

questions.question: How does a party become the official opposition?

choices.answer: Receive the second highest number of votes
Receive the highest number of votes
Receive the second highest number of seats
The number of seats a party wins
The number of votes a party receives
The way a representative represents certain populations

questions.question: What is the role of the media in relation to the government?

choices.answer: Pass on government messages to the people
Inform citizens of what their government is doing
Advertise products government wants people to buy
Make fun of the government officials whenever possible
An opinion based on unchallenged assumptions
Another name for a government departments or agencies
Being answerable to someone for your actions
The prime minister and the cabinet
The branch that monitors the government’s spending
Is another name for a government departments or agencies
An opinion based on unchallenged assumptions
What a law is before it is given Royal assent
The individual who monitors the government’s spending
The person hired to voice the views of a group on an issue

The individual monitors the government’s spending

Being given Royal assent

A person hired to voice the views of a group
A person who monitors the government’s spending
An opinion based on unchallenged assumptions
Having to answer to someone for your actions
